intro: Pilosella roxolanica subsp. adenocymosa, commonly known as the腺毛蒲公英, is a flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which are covered in fine, glandular trichomes. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically arranged in a composite head. It is native to parts of Europe and is often found in grassy areas and along roadsides. Due to its distinctive morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
